summary: Email chain regarding a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The correspondence is between a SigNet Technologies sales representative, a program manager, and a DOJ communication technician, discussing technical specifications and budgetary quotes for 272 cameras.

keyFacts: The document is a 2018 email chain concerning a security camera upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The proposed system involved 272 cameras and a new NVR (Network Video Recorder) system.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) was to provide conduit, cabling, and upgraded network infrastructure for the installation.
Technical specifications for the cameras, including confusion over a model not being a PTZ (Pan-Tilt-Zoom) camera, were discussed.
The correspondence shows procurement activity between the U.S. Department of Justice and a private contractor, SigNet Technologies.
